description: Retention of single storey rear extension (Retrospective application).
decision_conditions: The rear extension, by reason of its cumulative size, scale, bulk, design and depth from the original rear elevation of the building represents an oversized, incongruous and visually disproportionate form of development that is detrimental to the character and appearance of the original dwellinghouse and area, contrary to Policies DMHD 1, DMHD 11 and DMHD 12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).

The rear extension, by reason of its cumulative size, scale, bulk, depth and position is  detrimental to the amenities of the neighbouring occupier at 39 Fairholme Crescent, by virtue of overdomination, overshadowing, loss of light and loss of outlook contrary to Policies DMHD 1 and DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020), as well as paragraph 130 (f) of the NPPF (2021).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan (2021) and NPPF (2021).
